msItem.title: II. Ṣalotä ˤǝṭan “Prayer of Incense”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the names of the donor (or commissioner) and the copyst; the name of King Yoḥannǝs; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; abbreviations. msItem.incipit: Fol. 17v: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ በሰላም፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ዘፈነዎ፡ ወኃደረ፡ ውስተ፡ ማህፀና፡ ለድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ቅድስት። ሰላም፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር። ወእግዚአ፡ ኵሉ፡ ፍጥረት፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ወኢመኑሂ፡ ኈልቈ፡ ሰብሐቲሁ፡ ለመለኮት። …Fol. 17v: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the prayer of Incense in the peace to the Lord, the Father, the Son, Whom (They) sent and Who dwellt in the womb of the Virgin Saint Mary. Peace (is) from God and the Lord of all creatures. There is no one who can count the glory of the Divinity.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 36v, l.1: … ወንሴብሐከ፡ እኩት፡ ወስቡሕ፡ ስምከ፡ እግዚኦ፨ በእግዚአብሔር፡ ስምከ፡ ዘእምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ በአማኑኤል፡ ስምከ፤ ዘይትመዋዕ፡ ለፀር፡ በኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፤ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፨ በላዕለ፡ ዝንቱ፤ አስማቲከ፨ ተማህፀንኩ፡ አነ፡ ገብርከ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፨ ወጸሐፊሃ፡ አቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ሙሴ። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨Fol. 36v: … And we glorify You, Your name (is) praised and glorified, o Lord. Your name (is) in the Lord, Who (is) from before the world; Your name (is) in Emmanuel, Who was condemned for the enemy, in Jesus Christ, Savior of the world. On everything Your names. I, Your servant Kidanä Maryam, received in trust. And its (of the book) copyist (is) ʾabunä Wäldä Muse. Forever and ever. Amen.

And the assistant priest shall receive it into a covering (and say): "As Joseph and Nicodemus wrapped Your body in linen and You were well pleased with them, in the like manner be well pleased with us". May the hallowing, thanksgiving and the magnificence be accepted by the Lord the Father for the forgiveness of sins. Amen. May the Lord hear you in all that you have asked, and accept your sacrifice and offering …
msItem.explicit: Fol. 17r, l.3: … በረከቶሙ፡ ወትንብልና፡ ሣህሎሙ፡ ወገድለ፡ [n.l.]ማሆሙ። ወጸጋ፡ ረዲኦቶሙ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ አቡነ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፨ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ኦንጉሠ፡ ሰላም፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ሰላመ፡ ሀበነ፡ ወአጽንዕ፡ ሰላምከ፡ ላዕለ፡ ወስረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፨ ንሑር፡ ወንዕቱ፡ በሰላም፡ ውስተ፡ አብያቲነ፨Fol. 17r, l.3: … may their blessing and intercession, their compassion and the acts of their labour, and the grace of their help be with ʾabunä Kidanä Maryam. Forever and ever. Amen. O king of peace, Jesus Christ, give us the peace and confirm (us) in Your peace and forgive us our sins. May we leave and enter our homes in peace.

decoDesc.decoNote: I) Fol. 17r: Crude, coloured (black, reddish-brown) ornamental band at the explicit of Text I (geometric motifs).
II) Fol. 17v: Crude, coloured (black, reddish-brown) ornamental band at the incipit of Text II (geometric motifs).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations. Parchment guard is sewn into the centre fold of quire B (?). A small piece of parchment (?) and a piece of red cotton cloth are in the centre fold of quire V (between fols. 33v-34v).

origin.origDate: Mention of King Yoḥannǝs on fol. 9v (l.12), most probably king Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89). In other MSS. (s., e.g., MR-007, UM-023, MR-023) written by the scribe Wäldä Muse, also Metropolitan ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-1876) is mentioned.
